alert.note: Alert for Atlantic (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 2:21PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southern New Jersey, including the following county, Atlantic. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 220 PM EST, Flooding is ongoing across portions of the warned area. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that may experience flooding include... Hammonton, Egg Harbor City, Weymouth, Estell Manor, Corbin City, Mays Landing, English Creek, Dorothy, Elwood-Magnolia, Mizpah, Pomona and Folsom. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
